description: Test your knowledge of Christmas traditions, history, and celebrations

questions.question: Which country started the tradition of putting up Christmas trees?
questions.funFact: The first decorated Christmas tree was in Riga, Latvia, in 1510!
questions.story: The modern Christmas tree tradition began in 16th century Germany, where devout Christians brought decorated trees into their homes. Prince Albert, Queen Victoria's German husband, popularized the custom in England in 1848 when he set up a Christmas tree at Windsor Castle.

questions.question: What is the best-selling Christmas song of all time?
options: All I Want for Christmas Is You
questions.funFact: Bing Crosby's 'White Christmas' has sold over 50 million copies worldwide!
questions.story: Written by Irving Berlin and performed by Bing Crosby, 'White Christmas' was first released in 1942 during World War II. Its nostalgic lyrics resonated deeply with soldiers stationed overseas and their families back home, making it a timeless holiday classic.

questions.question: In Australia, what do they call Santa Claus?
questions.funFact: Australian Christmas celebrations often include beach barbecues and surfing!
questions.story: In Australia, Christmas occurs during summer, leading to unique traditions. While they use the name Father Christmas, he is often depicted wearing lighter clothing and sometimes arrives on a surfboard or in a ute (pickup truck) pulled by kangaroos instead of reindeer.
